summary: There is nothing special, difficult or obtuse in building a windows screensaver, basically you simply build a normal executable then change the extension from .exe to .scr.  A quick google search yielded up the [Digital-7 Mono font](http://www.dailyfreefonts.com/fonts/info/4774-Digital-7-Mono.html) Embedding a font for use in WPF is a matter of including the ttf file in the application with a build action of content and copied to the bin.
title: Basic Screen saver in WPF
